summary: This document is an email correspondence involving Jeffrey Epstein, Jes Staley, and Peter Mandelson regarding the Lujiazui Forum 2010 in Shanghai. The email discusses the participation of key figures in the forum and the importance of JPMorgan's representation at the event.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Epstein is the sender of the email discussing the Lujiazui Forum and its significance for JPMorgan.

persons.name: Jes Staley
persons.context: Staley is the recipient of the email from Epstein, indicating a professional relationship.

persons.name: Peter Mandelson
persons.context: Mandelson is mentioned as a speaker at the Lujiazui Forum and is involved in discussions about the event.

persons.name: Maree Glass
persons.context: Glass is involved in the email chain regarding the Lujiazui Forum and is coordinating details.

persons.name: Scott Sun
persons.context: Sun is mentioned as the contact person for the Lujiazui Forum, providing logistical details.

connections.description: Epstein and Staley are in communication regarding the Lujiazui Forum, indicating a professional relationship.
Mandelson is confirmed to join the forum, and Glass is coordinating details for his participation.
Glass is in communication with Sun regarding the logistics of the Lujiazui Forum.

events.title: Lujiazui Forum 2010
events.description: Discussion about the upcoming Lujiazui Forum in Shanghai, including participation of key figures and logistical arrangements.

keyFacts: The email discusses the Lujiazui Forum 2010, highlighting its significance for JPMorgan.
Peter Mandelson is confirmed as a speaker at the forum.
Maree Glass is coordinating details for the event and is in contact with Scott Sun.
Jeffrey Epstein is actively involved in the discussions regarding the forum.
The email mentions arrangements for first-class travel and accommodations for speakers.
